instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this macbook which was liquid damaged some time ago i managed to fix it but now came back with a fan spinning fast issue. I replaced the trackpad and keyboard to make sure and the IO board doesn't have any damage. I have <RESISTOR>R5270</RESISTOR> contacts missing completely and pin 1 is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> which i can connect with <RESISTOR>R5271</RESISTOR> but pin 2 is going to SMC. With the first liquid damage there was an issue near <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> but that's been taken care off. Any ideas would be appreciated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
You should run a tiny wire to the trace going to SMC.
If not possible, then need to remove SMC and run the wire directly to its pad.
0.03mm magnet wire is good enough.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: not a problem to run a wire the strange thing is that it worked before without the resistor the fan was fine not sure how...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: If macbook works and fan spinning fast, that is the most likely issue with some sensor. Install HwMonitor and read sensor values.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
He said to have a broken trace for I2C LIO bus.
Finstack sensor is not detected by SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
Hi guys. 

I ran a wire powers on but still fan spinning fast i connected all damaged contacts and traced them...  :unsure:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
What temp errors do you get?
Did you try disconnecting webcam?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: I haven't checked temps and the webcam yes i disconnected and still the same... The trackpad also i replaced and keyboard just to make sure because it was liquid damaged before. The movement of the trackpad is a bit slow

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: btw they had windows and mac os installed on the old ssd which i replaced also cause it was dead

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: The trace is <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_A_S3_SCL</SIGNAL> from <RESISTOR>R5271</RESISTOR> pin 2 to contact 138 on SMC. i also replaced <RESISTOR>R5270</RESISTOR>/71 and <RESISTOR>R7910</RESISTOR>/12 also and traced them good so they make a contact cause the board contacts were very bad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: Run HWMonitor, or corresponding EFI ASD (better).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: Back at this. Cannot seem to find the ASD to test out. With Hwmonitor it will only show temps nothing specific. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zOe8WLm7lyacCoF1aNReU1SC7Twcak6o/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

HWMonitor doesn't show any 128 degrees temp?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: It cannot start the app it's really slow

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message:
Did you try to run ASD without SSD inserted?
Also try without battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Fan spinning fast
threads.message: The battery is not connected and i haven't tried ASD without ssd but it's a new ssd cause the old one was damaged. Also it needs a new keyboard which i tried with a new keyboard and without keyboard. I need to make ASD tomorrow and try
